cot.content:
To solve the problem, Please think and reason step by step, then answer.
question:
What is the value of the letter ‘K’ in the game of Scrabble?
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process: 
In Scrabble, each letter has a specific point value based on its frequency and difficulty of use in the English language. To determine the value of the letter 'K', we can refer to the standard scoring system used in the game. 

According to the Scrabble letter values:
- The letter 'K' is categorized as a less common letter, which typically has a higher point value than more frequently used letters like vowels or common consonants. 

After checking the Scrabble letter values, we find that:
- The letter 'K' is worth 5 points.

Answer:
5

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
What is the value of the letter ‘K’ in the game of Scrabble?
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['However, with this set, according to the rules, if a blank is used as a "Y" it is worth 10 points, if a blank is used as a "Z" it is worth 15 points, and if a blank is used as a "K" it is worth 20 points. Each of those letters are so high in points, because they are used only in borrowed words. The score of 20 for a "K" is the highest known point value for any letter in any Scrabble score distribution worldwide. "Y" is absent in all sets except the paleographic extension of the first set because it is rare in Latin. "K" and "Z" are also absent in all sets because they are rare in Latin, while "J" is not considered separate from "I" in all sets except the third one, in which it is not included because it is rare in Latin. "W" is also absent in all sets because it did not exist in ancient times, and is used only in modern borrowed words.\n', 'The hierarchy of letters is similar to that of Scrabble; Q and Z are the highest-scoring tiles (each 10) followed by X and J (each 8) and so on, the most notable variance is that here L is worth five as opposed to just one in Scrabble. The player starts with two minutes to find as many words as he can; if he manages to use Q, Z, X, or J in any word he is awarded a further 10 seconds. After each successful entry the letters used are discarded with the matrix replacing those letters used with surrounding tiles from above and to the left, a void is thus formed to the top left of the game screen. There is an additional 500 point bonus awarded for clearing the grids with allowable words.\n', 'The Dutch version of Scrabble has a "Y" with a face value of eight. Some players used it to represent "IJ" or "Y". The recent Dutch version comes with an example game, which clearly indicates that "Y" is only "Y", and "IJ" should be composed of "I" and "J". In previous editions of Scrabble there was a single IJ sign.\n', 'BULLET::::- In chess notation, the letter K represents the King (WK for White King, BK for Black King).\n', 'In the notation system common in tournament play, columns are labeled with the letters "A–O" and rows with the numbers "1–15". (On "Scrabble" boards manufactured by Mattel as well as on the Internet Scrabble Club, rows are lettered while columns are numbered instead.) A play is usually identified in the format "xy WORD score" or "WORD xy score", where "x" denotes the column or row on which the play\'s main word extends, "y" denotes the second coordinate of the main word\'s first letter, and "WORD" is the main word. Although it is unnecessary, additional words formed by the play are sometimes listed after the main word and a slash. When the play of a single tile forms words in each direction, one of the words is arbitrarily chosen to serve as the main word for purposes of notation.\n']

cognition.content:
Fact-checking refers to the process of confirming the accuracy of a statement or claim through various sources or methods. 
This process aims to ensure that statements or claims are based on reliable and verifiable information while eliminating inaccurate or misleading content. 
Fact-checking may involve the examination of data, literature, expert opinions, or other trustworthy sources.
In the context of artificial intelligence, model illusion refers to the overconfidence response of the AI. 
When a model exhibits an 'illusion' (a tendency to output deceptive data), it indicates that the training data used by the model does not necessarily support the rationality of its outputs.
You are a scientist researching fact-checking and addressing model illusions in artificial intelligence. 
To answer the following question:
What is the value of the letter ‘K’ in the game of Scrabble?
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['However, with this set, according to the rules, if a blank is used as a "Y" it is worth 10 points, if a blank is used as a "Z" it is worth 15 points, and if a blank is used as a "K" it is worth 20 points. Each of those letters are so high in points, because they are used only in borrowed words. The score of 20 for a "K" is the highest known point value for any letter in any Scrabble score distribution worldwide. "Y" is absent in all sets except the paleographic extension of the first set because it is rare in Latin. "K" and "Z" are also absent in all sets because they are rare in Latin, while "J" is not considered separate from "I" in all sets except the third one, in which it is not included because it is rare in Latin. "W" is also absent in all sets because it did not exist in ancient times, and is used only in modern borrowed words.\n', 'The hierarchy of letters is similar to that of Scrabble; Q and Z are the highest-scoring tiles (each 10) followed by X and J (each 8) and so on, the most notable variance is that here L is worth five as opposed to just one in Scrabble. The player starts with two minutes to find as many words as he can; if he manages to use Q, Z, X, or J in any word he is awarded a further 10 seconds. After each successful entry the letters used are discarded with the matrix replacing those letters used with surrounding tiles from above and to the left, a void is thus formed to the top left of the game screen. There is an additional 500 point bonus awarded for clearing the grids with allowable words.\n', 'The Dutch version of Scrabble has a "Y" with a face value of eight. Some players used it to represent "IJ" or "Y". The recent Dutch version comes with an example game, which clearly indicates that "Y" is only "Y", and "IJ" should be composed of "I" and "J". In previous editions of Scrabble there was a single IJ sign.\n', 'BULLET::::- In chess notation, the letter K represents the King (WK for White King, BK for Black King).\n', 'In the notation system common in tournament play, columns are labeled with the letters "A–O" and rows with the numbers "1–15". (On "Scrabble" boards manufactured by Mattel as well as on the Internet Scrabble Club, rows are lettered while columns are numbered instead.) A play is usually identified in the format "xy WORD score" or "WORD xy score", where "x" denotes the column or row on which the play\'s main word extends, "y" denotes the second coordinate of the main word\'s first letter, and "WORD" is the main word. Although it is unnecessary, additional words formed by the play are sometimes listed after the main word and a slash. When the play of a single tile forms words in each direction, one of the words is arbitrarily chosen to serve as the main word for purposes of notation.\n']

question_info.question: What is the value of the letter ‘K’ in the game of Scrabble?
passages:
However, with this set, according to the rules, if a blank is used as a "Y" it is worth 10 points, if a blank is used as a "Z" it is worth 15 points, and if a blank is used as a "K" it is worth 20 points. Each of those letters are so high in points, because they are used only in borrowed words. The score of 20 for a "K" is the highest known point value for any letter in any Scrabble score distribution worldwide. "Y" is absent in all sets except the paleographic extension of the first set because it is rare in Latin. "K" and "Z" are also absent in all sets because they are rare in Latin, while "J" is not considered separate from "I" in all sets except the third one, in which it is not included because it is rare in Latin. "W" is also absent in all sets because it did not exist in ancient times, and is used only in modern borrowed words.
The hierarchy of letters is similar to that of Scrabble; Q and Z are the highest-scoring tiles (each 10) followed by X and J (each 8) and so on, the most notable variance is that here L is worth five as opposed to just one in Scrabble. The player starts with two minutes to find as many words as he can; if he manages to use Q, Z, X, or J in any word he is awarded a further 10 seconds. After each successful entry the letters used are discarded with the matrix replacing those letters used with surrounding tiles from above and to the left, a void is thus formed to the top left of the game screen. There is an additional 500 point bonus awarded for clearing the grids with allowable words.
The Dutch version of Scrabble has a "Y" with a face value of eight. Some players used it to represent "IJ" or "Y". The recent Dutch version comes with an example game, which clearly indicates that "Y" is only "Y", and "IJ" should be composed of "I" and "J". In previous editions of Scrabble there was a single IJ sign.
BULLET::::- In chess notation, the letter K represents the King (WK for White King, BK for Black King).
In the notation system common in tournament play, columns are labeled with the letters "A–O" and rows with the numbers "1–15". (On "Scrabble" boards manufactured by Mattel as well as on the Internet Scrabble Club, rows are lettered while columns are numbered instead.) A play is usually identified in the format "xy WORD score" or "WORD xy score", where "x" denotes the column or row on which the play's main word extends, "y" denotes the second coordinate of the main word's first letter, and "WORD" is the main word. Although it is unnecessary, additional words formed by the play are sometimes listed after the main word and a slash. When the play of a single tile forms words in each direction, one of the words is arbitrarily chosen to serve as the main word for purposes of notation.
